metadata.title: CVE-2011-2716 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - negligible
metadata.description:
The DHCP client (udhcpc) in BusyBox before 1.20.0 allows remote DHCPservers to execute arbitrary commands via shell metacharacters in the (1)HOST_NAME, (2) DOMAIN_NAME, (3) NIS_DOMAIN, and (4) TFTP_SERVER_NAME hostname options.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2011-2716` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

busybox - 1:1.22.0-9ubuntu1
busybox-initramfs - 1:1.22.0-9ubuntu1
busybox-static - 1:1.22.0-9ubuntu1
busybox-syslogd - 1:1.22.0-9ubuntu1
udhcpc - 1:1.22.0-9ubuntu1
udhcpd - 1:1.22.0-9ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: busybox package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:1.22.0-9ubuntu1').
